page.title: 12HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: {Rawden House}was known as The Grange and was originally built in 1500. It was bought in 1591 by William Thrugood, grandfather of Dame Elizabeth Rawden and formed part of her dowry at her marriage in 1611. The first Rawden to live there was her second son Marmaduke who after his journeys overseas settled at Hoddesdon in 1656. Dame Elizabeth left the property to her son who lived there until he died in 1701. The property then went to his daughter Sarah who sold the house. It is currently used as office accommodation and is undoubtedly one of the finest buildings in the High Street.
